text: How to count all elements in a nested dictionary?
How do I count the number of subelements in a nested dictionary in the most efficient manner possible?
The len() function doesn't work as I initially expected it to:
What if I actually want to count the number of subelements?
(e.g., expected result to be "6")  Is there a better way to do this rather than looping through each element and summing the qty of subelements?
In this particular application, I have about five million subelements to count and every clock cycle counts.
